page.title: 12BETTWS EVAN, DYFED
page.content: This name applies to an area including many farms and several small hamlets, as well as to the small village of {Bettws Evan}itself. This has only a telephone kiosk and church to show its centre. The Post Office was closed some time ago, and people now have to travel to{Beulah}for their nearest shopping. However there are some travelling shops, fish & chip van and the like. Children travel on hired buses to{school at Beulah or {Glynarthen}or are taken by parents. {Welsh}is still the main language, although this is changing due to increased number of English settling in the area. The area is called Bettws Ifan in Welsh.
